review.title: A Case Study in Knowledge Discovery and Elicitation in an Intelligent Tutoring Application
review.abstract: Most successful Bayesian network (BN) applications to datehave been built through knowledge elicitation from experts.This is difficult and time consuming, which has lead to recentinterest in automated methods for learning BNs from data. We present a case study in the construction of a BN in anintelligent tutoring application, specifically decimal misconceptions about the NBN-derived NPN , a bigness application that could be built using BN data.In our experiment, we used BN to generate an automated and non-numerical dataset based on the data collected in the form of a numerical chart, and were able to generate a graph based on the NBN data collected in the form of a numeric chart.We found a statistically significant interaction between the data collected and the NBN (Supplementary Table S1). Although we did not have to take advantage of this effect, the data we gathered were very similar to the data collected in the first time, but not in the second time.In this article we will briefly explain the potential benefits of BN-based BN and the potential drawbacks of this type of model to the development of a successful BN model.

metadata.title: A Case Study in Knowledge Discovery and Elicitation in an Intelligent Tutoring Application
metadata.abstractText: Most successful Bayesian network (BN) ap­ plications to date have been built through knowledge elicitation from experts. This is difficult and time consuming, which has lead to recent interest in automated methods for learning BNs from data. We present a case study in the construction of a BN in an intel­ ligent tutoring application, specifically dec­ imal misconceptions. We describe the BN construction using expert elicitation and then investigate how certain existing automated knowledge discovery methods might support the BN knowledge engineering process.
